attributes.action: Amend rules on British citizens and immigration to British Overseas Territories
attributes.additional_details: Although UK maintains strong relations with British Overseas Territories it is not possible for British citizens to immigrate, work and reside in the British Overseas Territories without applying for a specific visa. This severely limits the economic development of the British Overseas Territories and we ask the British Government to establish with the British Overseas Territories a system of free movement for British citizens who wish to live, work and reside in the British Overseas Territories and strengthen the economy of these territories.
attributes.background: British citizens cannot immigrate to the British Overseas Territories without a visa, limiting their economic development

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about immigration arrangements for British Overseas Territories are a matter for the governments of these territories, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
